remarks: Given two atoms not under the fiducial (reference) co-atom ` W ` , there is a third.  Lemma B in [Crawley] p. 112.  (Contributed by NM, 30-May-2012.)
statement:
cdlemb2.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdlemb2.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdlemb2.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdlemb2.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
cdlemb2 $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) /\ ( ( P e. A /\ -. P .<_ W ) /\ ( Q e. A /\ -. Q .<_ W ) ) /\ P =/= Q ) -> E. r e. A ( -. r .<_ W /\ -. r .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) $.
$d .<_ r $.
$d .\/ r $.
$d A r $.
$d K r $.
$d P r $.
$d Q r $.
$d W r $.
